    Chris Chung

    Data Science Project Portfolio

    Chris Chung is a data scientist with a background in retail and client facing who focuses on solving problems in the video game industry. Specifically, Chris uses Python and SQL to solve problems and generate insights to improve player retention and scale data systems.

    This data science portfolio is comprised of projects covering the full spectrum of the data science process. This portfolioâ€™s projects apply Python and SQL within a data science context to provide value to computer game companies.

    Projects Listed by Data Science Process

    1. Import Data

    Utilized the Spark DataFrame API to extract data from Chicago's Reported Crime Dataset (2001-2018)   15 Aug 2019

    2. Store Data

    Created a Database of Planet Information to Store Data so That Our Imaginary NASA Has Data to Query   16 Aug 2019
    Constructed Functions to Extract Live Concert Music Data from SeatGeek's API   16 Aug 2019

    3. Extract Data

    Created a Database of Planet Information to Store Data so That Our Imaginary NASA Has Data to Query   16 Aug 2019
    Constructed Functions to Extract Live Concert Music Data from SeatGeek's API   16 Aug 2019
    Used API calls to extract top articles from Hacker News (YCombinator)   10 Aug 2019

    4. Organize

    Finagled with IMDB datasets to Organize Data for Analysis of U.S. Movie Quality Over the Last 3 Decades   23 Aug 2019

    5. Tidy

    Finagled with IMDB datasets to Organize Data for Analysis of U.S. Movie Quality Over the Last 3 Decades   23 Aug 2019
    Dove into SeatGeek New York Concert Dataset to Clean Data for Future Visualization and Analysis   16 Aug 2019

    6. Transform Data

    Used K-means Clustering to Visualize Dominant Colors in an Image   09 Aug 2019

    7. Visualize Data

    Visualized Spotify Global's Top 200 Summer Songs 2019 with Tableau   06 Sep 2019
    Created a Detailed Plot Using Matplotlib to Visualize Sample Sales Data   11 Aug 2019

    8. Model Data

    Used Linear Regression to Model and Predict Housing Prices with the Classic Boston Housing Dataset   29 Aug 2019

    9. Understand the Data

    10. Communication

    11. Next Steps

    12. Document
